top_comment.text:
Hi Bold Bakers! What is a Chocolate Salami? It’s a no-bake, Sweet Chocolate 
Biscuit Cake with rich chocolate, cookies, nuts & fruit, that’s made to 
look like a salami—no meat here, I promise. And it’s a perfect edible gift 
for the holidays! Plus, get an entire playlist of great edible gifts from 
my YouTube friends that are sure to impress. Enjoy!﻿

captions.text: (Music)

Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking
Chocolate Biscuit Cake/Chocolate Salami

Hi Bold Bakers! I'm so excited for the holidays
and I hope you are too. This week I'm teaming

up with some other great YouTube channels
to bring you an edible gifts collection for

the holidays. My contribution to this collaboration
is a BIG & BOLD chocolate salami also known
as chocolate biscuit cake. So let's get baking!

So what's chocolate salami? Well, you might
also know it as chocolate biscuit cake or

tiffin slice. It is a really simple recipe,
requires no baking. You just need to mix it and put it in the refrigerator.

We're going to start out by melting our chocolate
and butter gently together. You can do it

over a bain-marie or you can do it in the
microwave. Just make sure you keep an eye
on it is it doesn't burn.

When your chocolate and butter is melted,
we're going to add in our sugar, cocoa powder,
and vanilla extract.
Now simply whisk these ingredients together.

This cake is really popular in Ireland. I
remember making it a lot growing up. The great

thing about it is it's a refrigerator cake
so you don't need to bake it.

You can't have chocolate biscuit cake without
biscuits. I'm using digestive biscuits because

in Ireland this is what you'd most commonly
use. But you can use graham cracker, shortbread,

even gluten free biscuits if you want to keep
it gluten free. Any of your favorite biscuits

or cookies will work perfectly. And if you
haven't had one of these guys, I strongly

suggest you do with a cup of team. They're
yummy. Mmm.

To prepare your cookies for your biscuit cake,
it's super simple. Just put your cookies in

a ziploc bag. Take out all the air. Take a
rolling pin and then just break them up. You

want to leave some crumbly bits, some chunks.
You want to have different texture. And doing
it in a bag keeps it nice and tidy.

Now add your cookies into your chocolate.
This is my favorite part of this recipe when

you can get really creative and add any flavors
you like.

To this mix, we're going to add our nuts.
I'm adding hazelnuts because I think Hazelnuts

are eaten a lot of times around the holidays.
It just reminds me of Christmas. I'm also

going to add toasted pistachios because I
love the color and the flavor.

For the dried fruit, I'm adding in cranberries
because it's the holiday season but you can

add in raisins or apricots or whatever dried
fruit you like.

Here's a really good tip when using dried
fruit is to rehydrate it before you add it

into a recipe. So pour over some hot water
over your dried fruit. Let it sit for 10 minutes.

Let it plump up. Then dry it off and put it
into your recipe.

And then simply mix all of these together.
I love the idea of giving edible gifts around

the holidays because it's really from the
heart, from your home and it tells the person
that you love them.

To give your biscuit cake extra oomph, you
can always add in liqueur like orange liqueur

or rum. Something that gives it a little bit
more extra depth. Also, coffee works really

well. But I'm going to add in some orange
zest because I feel like it's a great festive

flavor. Chocolate and orange work so well
together. And then just stir this in. And

if you don't like orange zest, you can leave
it out and maybe add in some extra vanilla
or any flavor that you like.

And that's how easy chocolate biscuit cake
is. We're going to shape it and get it into

the refrigerator so it can set. And don't
forget to taste it. That's my favorite part.
Mmm. This is gorgeous.

The recipe for this chocolate salami can be
found below the video in the description box.

And if you're new to my channel, welcome and
don't forget to subscribe.

To shape our chocolate salami into a salami,
you lay down some cling film. Lay down your

chocolate biscuit cake on your cling film.
Put on half of your mix. It smells so good.

Then simply wrap your cling film around it
and try to shape it like a sausage. If you

grab both ends kind of like a present or Christmas
cracker, and just roll it on the counter so

you can tighten up your roll. This looks perfect.
We're going to put it in the fridge and let

it set and then we're going to finish with
the decorating.

After a few hours when your chocolate salami
has set, we're going to toss it in icing sugar.

Generously dredge over the sugar. We want to cover
it completely. When it's totally covered in

icing sugar, we're going to now wrap it to
make it look like a salami. And that's why
it's called chocolate salami.

Now this part is a little tricky, it took
me a few times to get it.

With some twine, wrap a knot in the end. Then
take your string and make a loop. And then

turn the loop over. Make your way down the
log and then pull. Perfect! Make your loop.

Turn it over. Go down your salami and pull.
Oh my gosh, two in a row. Yesss! Gorgeous.

Almost there. Now can you start seeing it
looking like a salami. Make a loop. Turn it

over. And then pull. And there you have it,
a chocolate salami. It looks and is going
to taste amazing.

Now it's time to wrap up your edible gift.
Choose festive paper for your gift. Then place

parchment on top of the wrapping paper. Lay
your biscuit cake on top and then tightly roll

it up. You may want to secure it with a piece
of tape. Then just wrap up the ends. And tie
on a bow. You can even add your own label.

To serve your salami, simply slice it thick
with a sharp knife. You guys are going to

love this, and it is the perfect edible gift
for the holidays. Make sure you keep some
for yourself.

For more great gift ideas, make sure you watch
all of the other fantastic videos in this

playlist. Don't forget to subscribe to my
channel and I'll see you back here again next
Thursday for more Bigger Bolder Baking.

title: Chocolate Biscuit Cake/Chocolate Salami (No-Bake): Edible Gifts - Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking
